revised_title: Dielectric Constants of Organic Bodies and Electrolytes at Very Low Temperatures
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the dielectric constants of various organic bodies and electrolytes at very low temperatures using Nernst's method. They employed a modified Nernst bridge and an experimental condenser to measure the dielectric constants of substances such as ethylic alcohol, amyl alcohol, and ethylic ether. The results showed that the dielectric constants of these substances varied at different temperatures, providing insights into their properties at low temperatures.
